bioghist.p: The Levis family is allied to the Smith family through the marriage of Rebecca Levis Wood and Abraham Lewis Smith. Samuel Levis (1649-1734), the founder of the Pennsylvania family, settled in the state in 1682 and built the family home. About four generations later (?), Margaret Garrett Levis, one of Samuel Levis's descendants, married Joseph Wood. Their daughter, Rebecca Levis Wood (1837-1925), married Abraham Lewis Smith (1831-1914) on 28 April 1859. Abraham and Rebecca Smith's four children were Henry Clement, Rebecca Emily, Lewis Lawrence, and Helen Bright. Lewis Lawrence Smith was the father of Lawrence M.C. Smith, the husband of Eleanor Houston Smith.

scopecontent.p: The Levis Family Papers contain genealogical information on Levis (especially Samuel Levis I, II, and II), Davis, and Need families; Rebecca Levis Smith's application for membership in the Society of Colonial Dames of America; articles of agreement (1708); surveys by Samuel Levis Jr. (1717, 1730, 1735); Richard Penn deed of land to Samuel Levis; and correspondence to Rebecca, Mark, and Samuel Levis.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
